intro: Scopolia carniolica, commonly known as the Carniolan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces berries that are typically orange or red, containing seeds that are dispersed by animals. Scopolia carniolica is often found in rocky or forested areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in alpine gardens.
